section.leadIn: In relation to the provision of fire service installation or equipment, requirements with which an owner of a composite building, in respect of a part intended for domestic purposes, and an owner of a domestic building can be directed to comply under section 5(1) and (2) of this Ordinance are the following— (Amended 32 of 2024 s. 29)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a requirement to provide or improve a fire hydrant and hose reel system as a source of water supply for fire fighting; (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 115)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a requirement to provide or improve a manual fire alarm system to alert occupants of the building in the event of fire; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a requirement to provide or improve emergency lighting within the common parts so as to facilitate the evacuation of occupants of the building in the event of a power failure. (Amended 32 of 2024 s. 29)

section.continued: The detailed specifications and requirements of the installation or equipment under paragraphs (a) to (c) are set out in the Code of Practice for Minimum Fire Service Installations and Equipment 1994, as published by the Director of Fire Services and printed by the Government Printer. (Amended 32 of 2024 s. 29)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Fire safety construction
section.leadIn: In relation to fire safety construction, requirements with which an owner of a composite building, in respect of a part intended for domestic purposes, and an owner of a domestic building can be directed to comply under section 5(1) and (2) of this Ordinance are the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the protection of staircases with separating walls of fire resisting construction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the improvement of exit arrangements in terms of exit from the parts used for domestic purposes to the street;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the provision of fire doors.

section.continued: The detailed requirements on the design, construction or installation in relation to construction requirements in paragraphs (a) to (c) are set out in the following codes of practice published by the Director of Buildings and printed by the Government Printer—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the Code of Practice for the Provision of Means of Escape in Case of Fire 1996;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the Code of Practice for Fire Resisting Construction 1996; and

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the Code of Practice for Means of Access for Firefighting and Rescue 1995.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Fire Safety Measures to be Complied with by Occupiers of Composite Buildings in Respect of Parts Intended for Non-Domestic Purposes

section.name: s1
section.heading: Provision of fire service installation or equipment
section.leadIn: In relation to the provision of fire service installation or equipment, requirements with which an occupier of a composite building, in respect of a part intended for non-domestic purposes can be directed to comply under section 5(3) of this Ordinance are the following— (Amended 32 of 2024 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a requirement to provide or improve emergency lighting within the area he occupies so as to facilitate the evacuation of the area in the event of a power failure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a requirement to provide or improve an automatic cut-off device for the mechanical ventilating system to limit the spread of smoke through the ventilating system, but only if the system does not serve other separately occupied areas of the part of the building intended for non-domestic purposes and the system—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has a capacity to process air at a rate exceeding 1 cubic metre per second; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: serves more than one fire compartment located within such part.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Definition
section.def: fire compartment (防火間), in relation to a building, means a part of the building that is physically separated from adjoining parts by walls, and by a floor and ceiling, that meets the standard of fire resistance prescribed by the Code of Practice for Fire Resisting Construction 1996, as published by the Director of Buildings and printed by the Government Printer.
